Articles.Content:
I decided to start a new save game- which people will suggest missions for me . It works like this, you suggest me something to do, and I do it.

I want to start with basic satellites in orbit around Kerbin, then manned missions, then satellites to the Mun, manned to the Mun, and then so on. But you guys suggest what type of satellites I launch, what kind of orbit and more. I honestly think the fun would start after we get into the interplanetary stages! I sadly cannot do communications arrays for the life of me, so that cannot be suggested. So go ahead and suggest me things to do!

Current mission :
Strap Jeb to a SRB and ignite

Strap Jeb to a SRB and ignite

Are you serious...?

Are you serious...?

Yes, he's serious.

My idea

Get the Biodome mod and land 10 of them on the Mun. Have a party.
Put a full habitaion module on eloo and leave no trace. (I'm evil)

Here's a legit challenge. Why not start that satellite array round Kerbin in one big run using a spaceplane while launching all of them into different inclinations and perform the lot with the fuel left to get back to the runway

Here's a legit challenge. Why not start that satellite array round Kerbin in one big run using a spaceplane while launching all of them into different inclinations and perform the lot with the fuel left to get back to the runway

Finally a real one! Would the plane have to be an SSTO? I'm pretty bad at making them.
make a replica of the mercury-redstone freedom 7

Soviet Lunar Programme. Start off with simple Mun flyby probes, perform a soft landing with a probe, deposit a rover, and finish it all off with the manned landing the real Soviet Union never got around to.

Finally a real one! Would the plane have to be an SSTO? I'm pretty bad at making them.

Whatever works for you. I've not managed to make an SSTO plane myself yet either

make a replica of the mercury-redstone freedom 7

That's not too difficult. I prefer trying a Gemini-Titan. Good luck getting past the capsule! (excluding Mulbin)

Try a multi-gravity assist mission similar to the voyager program. Might require an hour or two of fiddling with maneuver modes (and an edit to the conic setting in the config file) but it will feel great when you accomplish it!

Here is a neat mission if you like navigation. Do a mission to Eeloo via Laythe.

So transfer to Jool then aerobrake directly to Laythe. Then head for Eeloo using a Tylo swingby to help. Land on Eeloo then return to Kerbin. This is all very possible and probably more efficient than a direct Eeloo return mission.

I'm trying Kerb's challenge first, then appollo's and so on.

-No More Suggeestions until I finished those-

Probably will take a lot of time anywa, might not finish the voyager, or the Eeloo via Laythe.

Edited August 3, 2013 by JelloTickles
